MINUTES OF THE SITTING OF 29 OCTOBER 2015 IN THE CHAIR: Sylvie GUILLAUME Vice-President 1. Opening of the sitting The sitting opened at 8.30. 2. Request for the waiver of parliamentary immunity The Polish authorities had forwarded a request to waive the parliamentary immunity of Robert Jarosław Iwaszkiewicz in relation to proceedings pending in respect of an administrative offence. Pursuant to Rule 9(1), the request had been referred to the committee responsible, the JURI Committee. 3. Hearing on summer-time changes in Europe (debate) Question for oral answer (O-000111/2015) by Pavel Svoboda, on behalf of the JURI Committee, and Michael Cramer, on behalf of the TRAN Committee, to the Commission: Hearing on summer-time changes in Europe (2015/2722(RSP)) (B8-0768/2015) Pavel Svoboda and Michael Cramer moved the question. Violeta Bulc (Member of the Commission) answered the question. The following spoke: Herbert Reul, on behalf of the PPE Group, Evelyn Regner, on behalf of the S&D Group, Merja Kyllönen, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, Heidi Hautala, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Olaf Stuger, on behalf of the ENF Group, Heinz K. Becker and Gilles Lebreton. The following spoke under the catch-the-eye procedure: Anna Záborská, Doru-Claudian Frunzulică, Notis Marias, Bronis Ropė, Tomáš Zdechovský, Beatrix von Storch, Michaela Šojdrová and Seán Kelly. The following spoke: Violeta Bulc. The debate closed. 4. Safe use of remotely piloted aircraft systems (RPAS) in the field of civil aviation (debate) Report on safe use of remotely piloted aircraft systems (RPAS), commonly known as unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), in the field of civil aviation [2014/2243(INI)] — Committee on Transport and Tourism. Rapporteur: Jacqueline Foster (A8-0261/2015) Jacqueline Foster introduced the report. The following spoke: Violeta Bulc (Member of the Commission). The following spoke: Soraya Post (rapporteur for the opinion of the LIBE Committee), Renaud Muselier, on behalf of the PPE Group, Janusz Zemke, on behalf of the S&D Group, Evžen Tošenovský, on behalf of the ECR Group, Matthijs van Miltenburg, on behalf of the ALDE Group, Davor Škrlec, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Peter Lundgren, on behalf of the EFDD Group, Marie-Christine Arnautu, on behalf of the ENF Group, Marian-Jean Marinescu, Claudia Tapardel, Anneleen Van Bossuyt, Dominique Riquet, Jill Seymour and Christine Revault D'Allonnes Bonnefoy. 17.11.2016 EN C 423/593 Official Journal of the European Union Thursday 29 October 2015

The following spoke under the catch-the-eye procedure: Cláudia Monteiro de Aguiar, Doru-Claudian Frunzulică, Notis Marias, Izaskun Bilbao Barandica, Patricija Šulin, Lucy Anderson and Ivan Jakovčić. The following spoke: Violeta Bulc and Jacqueline Foster. The debate closed. Vote: minutes of 29.10.2015, item 10.6 . 5. New challenges and concepts for the promotion of tourism in Europe (debate) Report on new challenges and concepts for the promotion of tourism in Europe [2014/2241(INI)] — Committee on Transport and Tourism. Rapporteur: Isabella De Monte (A8-0258/2015) Isabella De Monte introduced the report. The following spoke: Violeta Bulc (Member of the Commission). The following spoke: Maria Grapini (rapporteur for the opinion of the IMCO Committee), Luigi Morgano (rapporteur for the opinion of the CULT Committee) and Cláudia Monteiro de Aguiar, on behalf of the PPE Group. IN THE CHAIR: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ Vice-President The following spoke: Ismail Ertug, on behalf of the S&D Group, who also replied to a blue-card question by István Ujhelyi, Kosma Złotowski, on behalf of the ECR Group, Jozo Radoš, on behalf of the ALDE Group, Curzio Maltese, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, who also replied to a blue-card question by Maria Grapini, Jill Evans, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Peter Lundgren, on behalf of the EFDD Group, who also replied to a blue-card question by Silvia Costa, Marie-Christine Arnautu, on behalf of the ENF Group, Lampros Fountoulis, non-attached Member, who also replied to a blue-card question by Maria Grapini, Luis de Grandes Pascual, Claudia Tapardel, Tomasz Piotr Poręba, Izaskun Bilbao Barandica, Tania González Peñas, who also replied to a blue-card question by Tibor Szanyi, Daniela Aiuto, Massimiliano Salini, Miltiadis Kyrkos, Sofia Sakorafa, Deirdre Clune, István Ujhelyi, Salvatore Domenico Pogliese, Linda McAvan, and Silvia Costa, who also replied to a blue-card question by Ismail Ertug. The following spoke under the catch-the-eye procedure: Francisco José Millán Mon, Doru-Claudian Frunzulică, Notis Marias, Ivan Jakovčić, Kostas Chrysogonos, Dubravka Šuica, Nicola Caputo, Lefteris Christoforou and Patricija Šulin. The following spoke: Violeta Bulc and Isabella De Monte. The debate closed. Vote: minutes of 29.10.2015, item 10.7 . 6. Development of a satellite-based technology to enable global flight tracking systems (debate) Question for oral answer (O-000118/2015) by Michael Cramer, on behalf of the TRAN Committee, to the Commission: Development of a satellite-based technology to enable global flight tracking systems (2015/2857(RSP)) (B8-1101/2015) Michael Cramer moved the question. Violeta Bulc (Member of the Commission) answered the question. C 423/594 EN 17.11.2016 Official Journal of the European Union Thursday 29 October 2015

The following spoke: Marian-Jean Marinescu, on behalf of the PPE Group, Lucy Anderson, on behalf of the S&D Group, Jacqueline Foster, on behalf of the ECR Group, Pavel Telička, on behalf of the ALDE Group, and Ismail Ertug. The following spoke under the catch-the-eye procedure: Cláudia Monteiro de Aguiar and Notis Marias. The following spoke: Violeta Bulc. Motion for a resolution to wind up the debate tabled under Rule 128(5): — Michael Cramer, on behalf of the Committee on Transport and Tourism, on allocation by the World Radiocommunication Conference, to be held in Geneva from 2 to 27 November 2015 (WRC-15), of the necessary radio spectrum band to support the future development of a satellite-based technology to enable global flight tracking systems 2015/2857(RSP) (B8-1094/2015). The debate closed. Vote: minutes of 29.11.2015, item 10.8 . (The sitting was suspended at 11.25 pending voting time and resumed at 11.35.) IN THE CHAIR: Martin SCHULZ President 7. Sakharov Prize 2015 (announcement of the winner) The President announced that the Conference of Presidents had decided to award the Sakharov Prize 2015 to the Saudi Arabian blogger Raif Badawi. The Prize would be awarded on 16 December 2015 in Strasbourg. IN THE CHAIR: Alexander Graf LAMBSDORFF Vice-President The following spoke: Anna Maria Corazza Bildt, Marine Le Pen and Manfred Weber on possible irregularities reported at voting time the previous day (the President confirmed that the matter had been raised at the Conference of Presidents that morning and would be investigated). 8. Welcome On behalf of Parliament, the President welcomed members of a delegation from the Peshmerga military units in the autonomous Kurdistan region of Iraq led by General Ali Jafar — who had taken their seats in the distinguished visitors' gallery. 9. Approval of the minutes of the previous sitting The minutes of the previous sitting were approved. 10. Voting time Detailed voting results (amendments, separate and split votes, etc.) appear in the Results of Votes annex to the minutes. The results of roll-call votes are available in electronic form only, as an annex to the minutes, and can be accessed via Europarl. 17.11.2016 EN C 423/595 Official Journal of the European Union Thursday 29 October 2015

The explanations of vote which had not been given that day would be submitted in writing. The following spoke: Danuta Jazłowiecka and Seán Kelly to protest against the President's decision to suspend the sitting (the President noted their comments). 12. Corrections to votes and voting intentions Corrections to votes and voting intentions appear on the Europarl website under ‘Plenary/Votes/Results of Votes (Results of roll-call votes)’. They are published in hard copy in the ‘Results of roll-call votes’ annex. The electronic version on Europarl will be regularly updated for a maximum of two weeks after the day of the vote concerned. After the two-week deadline has passed, the list of corrections to votes and voting intentions will be finalised so that it can be translated and published in the Official Journal. 13.
